intro: Lomatocarpa multivittata, commonly known as the multivittate lomatocarpa, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its deep root system and drought tolerance. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, ranging in color from white to pale pink, and it produces small, leathery pods that contain several seeds.
